main.greeting: My name is Tor Kingdon and I tell stories with code.
main.blurb: I've been working in the entertainment business since I was a kid (specifically sound for TV & film) and have decided to use my computer skills to write code instead of making funny noises.

profileImage.altText: Tor in front of Carnegie Hall

projects.description: Bicycle-friendly bicycle directions. It was programmed with Python, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. I also used the frameworks/libraries Flask, WTForms, Jinja2, Bootstrap, jQuery and plugins from Mapbox & Select2. It uses APIs from Mapbox, Mapquest, and Open Weather Service.
My down-n-dirty take on the classic dice/word game using Python/Flask.

I produced an “illustrated audio play” with my partner and a wrtier/director we’ve worked with before, and I made our website. The backend is still in development using Node JS and the Strapi library.

about.statement: I've been using computers since the Commodore PET, and programming since PASCAL was pretty hot stuff. I learned PASCAL first on my family's Apple ][+ with the RAM expansion to 64k! I graduated with a concentration in Computer Science from Kalamazoo College where I learned a variety of database skills along with the basic structure applicable to all programming languages. Learning how to 'think like a computer' has served me very well in everything I've done, from temping in offices to mixing feature films.

work.description: I have rediscovered a love for computers that has been with me since my first experience at a computer drop-in. I'm working primarily in web app development (full stack) but am also looking to merge my audio post-production experience with coding.

Kathleen Edwards, M.P.S.E. and I founded Hear Kitty Studios to combine our talents and offer anyone interested in producing television, radio or podcast content the highest quality sound possible. We are passionate about post-production sound, crafting custom soundscapes to make every project we work on sound its best.
